concise_definition: v. 记得, 回忆, 记住

definitions.explanation_en: To have or retain in one's memory; to recall information, events, or experiences from the past.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在脑海中保留或回忆起过去的信息、事件或经历。
definitions.example_en: I remember the day we first met like it was yesterday.
definitions.example_cn: 我记得我们第一次见面的那天，就像发生在昨天一样。

definitions.explanation_en: To keep in mind or bear in mind, especially as a reminder of something important or meaningful.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将某事铭记于心，尤其作为对重要或有意义事物的提醒。
definitions.example_en: Remember to thank your teachers for their hard work.
definitions.example_cn: 别忘了感谢老师们的辛勤付出。

definitions.explanation_en: To be aware of or recognize someone or something based on prior knowledge or experience.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指根据先前的知识或经验，意识到或认出某人或某物。
definitions.example_en: She remembers him from high school, though they haven't spoken in years.
definitions.example_cn: 她记得他，他们高中时认识，尽管已经多年没说过话了。

comparison.analysis: “Recall” (回忆) 更强调主动地、有意识地从记忆中提取信息，常用于正式或需要努力回想的语境，如证人回忆案发经过。而 “remember” 更自然、更常用，可以是自动浮现的记忆，不一定需要刻意努力。
“Memorize” (背诵/熟记) 指通过重复或刻意练习将信息牢固地存储在记忆中，强调学习过程和准确性。而 “remember” 是记忆的结果，不涉及主动学习行为。例如：你 memorize 了电话号码，但你 remember 它是因为你经常使用。
“Forget” (忘记) 是 “remember” 的反义词，指失去对某事的记忆。两者常形成对比，用于强调记忆的存续或缺失。例如：I remember his name, but I forget his face. 但 “forget” 本身不包含记忆的主动性，仅表示缺失。
